@graph.caption: slices of strawberry bread on a white background

@graph.name: No Iodine Strawberry Bread!! - Vegan Richa
@graph.description: An easy and delicious no iodine strawberry bread made with fresh strawberries. Great for sandwiches, snacks and breakfast. Vegan Recipe.

@graph.name: No Iodine Strawberry Bread
@graph.description: An easy and delicious no iodine strawberry bread made with fresh strawberries. Great for sandwiches, snacks and breakfast. Vegan Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 2 cups fresh strawberries pureed with minimal water ((the puree should be about 1.5 cups))
1.5 teaspoon quick rise yeast and .5 teaspoon regular active yeast
1 teaspoon non iodized salt (( Ididn't have this))

recipeInstructions.text: Warm the water and add yeast to it. Let sit for 10 minutes or until frothy.
recipeInstructions.name: Warm the water and add yeast to it. Let sit for 10 minutes or until frothy.

recipeInstructions.text: Grease the mixer bowl and add the flours.
recipeInstructions.name: Grease the mixer bowl and add the flours.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the rest of the ingredients and the yeast mixture and knead for 10-12 minutes(2-4 minutes then scrape and so on). Add more water if needed. The strawberries will keep giving out their moisture, so try to keep the dough a little on the dry side.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the rest of the ingredients and the yeast mixture and knead for 10-12 minutes(2-4 minutes then scrape and so on). Add more water if needed. The strawberries will keep giving out their moisture, so try to keep the dough a little on the dry side.

recipeInstructions.text: Keep the dough in a well greased bowl, covered for about 1.5 hours to rise.
recipeInstructions.name: Keep the dough in a well greased bowl, covered for about 1.5 hours to rise.

recipeInstructions.text: Punch the dough to remove excess air and shape it into a loaf using the boule technique by pulling on all sides and tucking them under. Use some oil on your palms and some flour to avoid the stickiness. The dough will be stickier than usual, because of the extra moisture of the strawberries.
recipeInstructions.name: Punch the dough to remove excess air and shape it into a loaf using the boule technique by pulling on all sides and tucking them under. Use some oil on your palms and some flour to avoid the stickiness. The dough will be stickier than usual, because of the extra moisture of the strawberries.

recipeInstructions.text: Place loaf in a well greased pan, cover with a towel, and let rise for 40 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Place loaf in a well greased pan, cover with a towel, and let rise for 40 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake bread at 375 degrees F for 40-45 minutes or until it sounds nice and hollow!
recipeInstructions.name: Bake bread at 375 degrees F for 40-45 minutes or until it sounds nice and hollow!

recipeInstructions.text: The crust will feel hard when taken out of the oven, but an hour later it will soften up nicely.. because of the strawberries!!
recipeInstructions.name: The crust will feel hard when taken out of the oven, but an hour later it will soften up nicely.. because of the strawberries!!

recipeInstructions.text: Enjoy toasted with anything, at any time of the day!
recipeInstructions.name: Enjoy toasted with anything, at any time of the day!
